DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions addressing the discontinuation of interventions and/or procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Were the interventions or pro
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were the interventions or procedures discontinued accordingly?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received hydroxyurea or glucocorticoids for suppression of leukocytosis, have these agents been discontinued at least 24 hours prior to initiation of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled on Phase I portion, has prior EGFR-TKIs (except erlotinib) been discontinued at least 7 days prior to initiation of erlotinib and Onalespib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient requires treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g. denosumab) can it be discontinued before treatment with atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient requires treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g. denosumab), is patient able to discontinue it before treatment with atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g. denosumab) which cannot be discontinued before treatment with atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on chronic anticoagulation treatment, is patient able and willing to have this treatment discontinued for the biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off other anti-cancer therapy, including ACT, for 28 days prior to study administration of atexolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving hydroxyurea, has it been discontinued on the day prior to the start of chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does treating physician agree to suspend cancer chemotherapy for patients in cancer remission during tocilizumab treatment phase until the patient improves to Clinical Ordinal Scale of 1 or 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on long-acting somatostatin analogs (e.g., long-acting octreotide) can it be discontinued at least 4 weeks prior to initiating Lutetium Lu 177 Dotatate or will it be continued for patient who has a history of carcinoid syndrome and requires long-acting somatostatin analog for control of his/her functional syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on chronic anticoagulation treatment, is patient unable and unwilling to have this treatment discontinued for the biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient not proceed to cycle 6 due to discontinuation of Isotretinoin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient on chronic anticoagulation treatment, that cannot be discontinued during the time interval necessary to undergo a biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was study drug administration discontinued during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient discontinue chemotherapy for non-malignant conditions prior to starting protocol therapy?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient discontinue chemotherapy for non-malignant conditions prior to starting protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors or anti CTLA4 antibodies, were they permanently discontinued from further treatment because of an adverse event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off cytotoxic chemotherapy, immunotherapy, major surgery (other than diagnostic surgery, dental surgery or stenting), or other investigational therapy more than 3 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Permanent discontinuation of everolimus

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient meet any criteria that resulted in permanent discontinuation of study treatment during induction treatment phase, as outlined in section 5.4.
